page.title: 03OYSTERS AT HAMPTON,HERNE BAY
page.content: In 1985 Hampton Pier is a short solid concrete structure about 70 yards long and from the end of this a line of rocks show how the original pier extended further into the sea. The Pier appears to be of little practical use but during the second half of the last Century it was very busy with the boats which came from English and Continental ports in connection with the oyster trade. Twice a week oysters were taken to Billingsgate from the Hampton Oyster Beds and there was also a tramway from the Pier to the railway line. The oyster beds extended about three miles from the shore. There were breeding pits inshore and the Company built a row of 12 cottages for their employees. The Company folded before the turn of the Century apparently after several sevre winters. The cottages are gone as their land eroded
